plants.name: Lavandula angustifolia
plants.description: A fragrant shrub known for its aromatic purple flower spikes, English Lavender thrives in Mediterranean climates and is widely cultivated in gardens. It attracts pollinators and is used for essential oils.
plants.funFact: Lavender was used by ancient Egyptians for mummification and by Romans for bathing and cooking.

plants.name: Rosa rugosa
plants.description: A hardy wild rose species with fragrant, pink to white flowers followed by bright red hips rich in vitamin C. It grows naturally along coastal areas and is often planted in gardens for its resilience.
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere temperate zones, coastal areas of Europe and Asia
plants.funFact: Its dense growth and thorny stems make it excellent for coastal erosion control and wildlife habitats.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A tall perennial herbaceous plant bearing dense, colorful spikes of pea-like flowers. Native to western North America, it is popular in wildflower mixes and gardens for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
plants.location: Western North America, spread to parts of Europe and New Zealand
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen through symbiosis with root bacteria.
